ca.mcgill.hs.graph
Class MagnitudeGraphView

java.lang.Object
  android.view.View
      ca.mcgill.hs.graph.MagnitudeGraphView
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback
public class MagnitudeGraphView
extends android.view.View

This is the main view for the MagnitudeGraph activity. It draws the activity graph between two timestamps, and the user can select bits of it in order to label activities.

Nested Class Summary
 class MagnitudeGraphView.Node
          Node class used only for storing labels and timestamps from this graph.

Constructor Detail

MagnitudeGraphView

public MagnitudeGraphView(android.content.Context context,
                          java.lang.String title,
                          float[] values,
                          int[] activities,
                          long start,
                          long end)
The basic constructor for this object. This draws a graph with the appropriate values given and the correct timestamps.

Parameters:
context - The context in which this View will be drawn.
title - The graph title.
values - The values which will be drawn in the graph.
start - The start timestamp for the graph.
end - The end timestamp for the graph.

Adjusts the drawn rectangle to prevent overlapping with other rectangles.

private java.lang.Boolean checkLabel()
Checks the text input label from the user to make sure it is not of length 0 and does not contain illegal characters.

Returns:
true if the input string is acceptable, false otherwise
